newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit stays under pressure,but support at 2.5250.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit stays under pressure,but support at 2.5250.

text.p: The ringgit remained under pressure from fund demand for the dollar throughout the session but its fall was again limited by the continued presence of Bank Negara Malaysia at 2.5250 a dollar, dealers said.
"Negara is still there at 2.5250," a dealer with a European bank in Singapore said, adding that local corporate selling was also capping the dollar's rise at that level.
News of a trade surplus in May had no impact on the market, dealers said. Malaysia posted a 156.8 million ringgit surplus for May, compared with a 2.13 billion ringgit deficit in April.
At 1000 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.5240/50 to a dollar.
Bank Negara had aggressively defended the ringgit at 2.5250, with banking sources saying the central bank had sold around $400 million last week.
This has led many to "punt" the range, going short on approach of the 2.5250 level and covering on the occasional dips, said one dealer.
Dealers said the ringgit was expected to remain under pressure from offshore dollar bids with stop-loss sales seen above the 2.5270 level.

They said speculators were waiting to buy any dips to 2.5240 and below. Having obtained ringgit funds from long swap positions, speculators are not worried about any Bank Negara-engineered squeeze on liquidity as they do not need to fund their positions, dealers said.
On Friday, the ringgit weakened on rumours that Bank Negara would be holding meetings with local bank heads to discuss some possible restriction on ringgit lending to offshore players.
But banking sources said there was no such meeting.
